page.enlisting:
• To preserve a site, we need to enumerate the full set of a • For non trivial web sites: – The membership of W depends on who is asking – W is unknown (unknowable?) – W can only be approximated • There is no HTTP mechanism to define W • Sitemaps are a method to convey locally-held knowledge • To preserve a site, we need to enumerate the full set of a

page.enlisting:
• Counting problem – Web crawler behavior on decaying web sites (D-Lib 2006) – Web crawler behavior on deep and wide web sites (D-Lib 2008) – Defining W on a departmental web site (unpublished) • Representation problem – Dissemination time preservation metadata (JCDL 2007, IWAW – Performance evaluation of metadata utilities (ECDL 2008) • Reference implementation: mod_oai, an Apache module – uses Sitemaps, OAI-PMH resource harvesting for counting – uses “CRATE” -- base64’d resource + metadata output as the • Counting problem

page.enlisting:
• OAI-ORE support – CRATEs as Resource Maps • Defining CRATEs as an http encoding format – like gzip, zip, etc. – can return a CRATE in response to a regular http request with • Third party metadata – how can my web server use your installation of Jhove? • Tighter http log / Sitemap integration: – “Sitemap strict” -- don’t serve a file unless it appears in a – “Sitemap synch” -- in real-time, add/delete entries in Sitemap • OAI-ORE support
